taxonomicnotes: This species was described from western Java (Bleeker 1846), and has been previously confused with (and misidentified as) M. nigriceps in earlier literature. The conspecificity of the populations from Sundaic and mainland Southeast Asia await further verification.
rationale: This is an abundant species throughout much of its range, being frequently encountered in large numbers. In the absence of any major threats identified for this species, it is assessed as Least Concern, however taxonomic review of sub-populations is recommended.
